intro: Ursinia subhirsuta, commonly known as the hairy ursinia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it produces bright yellow to orange flowers. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance. Ursinia subhirsuta thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders.
